at.tuwien.ifs.somtoolbox.util

Class JMultiLineToolTip

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JToolTip
            • at.tuwien.ifs.somtoolbox.util.JMultiLineToolTip
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class JMultiLineToolTip
extends javax.swing.JToolTip
    This class implements tooltips that can span over multiple lines.

    As for the super class JToolTip, the rendering is done in via a sub-class of ToolTipUI, also an own subclass has to be created for this tooltip - MultiLineToolTipUI.
    Also, any class derived from JComponent automatically supports JToolTip. However, since we want a component to support our multi-line tooltip, we have to also subclass all components that should support the new tooltip. In the SOMtoolbox, JMultiLineRadioButtonMenuItem is currently the only class doing this.

    The original code was found at code found at Java CodeGuru and is written by Zafir Anjum.
    Version:
    $Id: JMultiLineToolTip.java 3888 2010-11-02 17:42:53Z frank $
    Author:
    Michael Dittenbach
